poem:
"Fall of a Metal Feather"

Boeing's shares as fragile as birch leaf,
cast from safe folds to the market's wild winds.
Panel torn from tin bird mid-soaring,
Yet it's not metal we mourn
But faith so easily broken; its shards
Lost among house rows, blasted at earth,
Revealing our trust in loud iron,
Yet an altar not to God, but to hubristic flight.
